website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a relatively cheap way to add Bluetooth wireless audio streaming to a powered speaker or audio component with an audio input, the Logitech Wireless Speaker Adapter is a good solution.
pros: The affordable Logitech Wireless Speaker Adapter adds Bluetooth streaming capabilities to anything with an audio (auxiliary) input, or a pair of powered speakers
cons: It's "wireless," but needs to be plugged in to the audio component (and a wall outlet)

customer_reviews.title: Good product idea, flawed product due to audio stream stuttering
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Logitech since 2013, and have always been frustrated with it. The audio received by it from from my Macbook Pro stutters constantly unless the device is within 8ft (i.e. in the same room). If I place it in the next room (12ft away) behind a wall (with open door) it stutters. I've just ordered the Homespotto see if it's any better. I do like that it has full RCA jacks to connect to the stereo amplifier... but it's not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: PG

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT speaker for Sound, Size and Price.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent speaker for the size and price. It doesn't come with all the bells and whistles like some others but if crisp sound and volume is what you want than you'll love this little speaker. Very well built I have dropped it many times and never had any problems. I compared it to many more expensive speakers like Bose,JBL.etc. and it has much better sound and volume.
customer_reviews.author: Jwderos

customer_reviews.title: Flawless!
customer_reviews.text: First of all its a logitech. And second of all its a logitech. But most important is that it is a logitech. My music sounds better through it than connected through wires, odd, but true. It just works perfectly. Worth every penny and then some. You can turn any speaker that has 3.5mm out put or RCA output into a bluetooth speaker. No need to go get an expensive bluetooth speakers, when you can spend less than 40 beans and get this little device. You can easily disconnect from one device to another as well. Get this one, you are just like me, for you we were seeking the same thing. And this baby works so smooth. Alex
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro G.

customer_reviews.title: Just ok.
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick but there are better products out there. Mine makes a slight high pitched noise when plugged in. You can't hear it when there is any sound in the room but when it is quiet I find it pretty annoying. The Bluetooth range is ok but can be choppy if you move your connected device around. I tried to use it with my iPhone during a small house party. It worked 70% but would cut out at times if the signal was blocked by too many people. Nice and compact and really easy to set up though. Would probably test out a couple other similar devices to make sure it suites your application.
customer_reviews.author: TheGuy

customer_reviews.title: Great bang for your buck!
customer_reviews.text: This little device is fantastic! It lets you use your smartphone or tablet, wirelessly with your existing stereo system and all for only forty bucks! Match this with an all-you-can-stream service, such as Spotify and you have an incredible combo. As always, Logitech has made another solid and easy-to-use piece of hardware. It's basically idiot-proof. Just be aware, you may have to go into your phone/tablet's Bluetooth settings to select this adapter if you have paired more than one gadget (such as a Bluetooth headset). Like any other Bluetooth device, the sound occasionally cuts out for 1-3 seconds and resumes, but for casual listening, this is no problem. Just don't plan to use this for your next professional DJ gig.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Bachman

customer_reviews.title: Logitech makes excellent products, including this adapter.
customer_reviews.text: Logitech's adapter has a separate AC adapter allowing you to carefully position the adapter. Be aware as you shop for these Bluetooth adapters, that some plug directly into a wall. A feature like that may hide the device behind furniture making it interfere with transmission distance. Some devices require a USB port. Logitech's does not. I use the Logitech adapter at a distance of about 25 feet, line of sight. Sometimes, if someone walks in between the device and my phone, I get a stutter in the music.Bluetooth just isn't a strong enough signal. Other times the phone gets busy also causing a stutter. This is obviously not Logitech's fault.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph W.

customer_reviews.title: Best of Three
customer_reviews.text: I tested three receivers as input to a. This Logitech receiver works about as well the smaller, more expensive. Both work considerably better than thewhich exhibited audible compression artifacts. I have also tried the modification suggested by another reviewer but found that the advantage (if any) was rather less than claimed. Having spent a tidy sum on all three devices I can't say that I've found what I sought, but to anyone seeking reception beyond the ten meter norm, I suggest considering thewhich I have not yet tested.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: streaming and connection work well
customer_reviews.text: Sound qaulity is good and it connects fine(although it does not auto connect i have to initiate connection from my phone manually) my only complaint is the range. I have a fairly large ranch style home ~62 feet long. I placed this unit on top of my stereo (in the center of my house)expecting it to pretty much cover the house. It makes it to one end of the house but will not stay connected in my master bedroom/bath. I use this for built in ceiling speakers that are spread throuhgout the house. Annoying not to be able to control the song when in that end of my house.
customer_reviews.author: on2wheels

customer_reviews.title: Fan of Logitech for many years but this one's a ...
customer_reviews.text: Fan of Logitech for many years but this one's a dog. Mine was purchased two years ago and the fact that the output volume is so low is a killer for me. I have it connected to my 200W AV receiver and you have to turn the volume up soooo high with this device and if you forget to lower it, when the kids turn on the TV it blows their ears out. So I rarely use it and just use my OONTZ portable. But I want to use my home stereo again...There are too many other devices competing in this space. I am replacing this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Timo-MA

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this for connecting my Iphone to my Home Stereo. I knew that bluetooth didn't have great sound but it would be enough to listen to around the house. It paired up easily and sounded tolerable... until I walked about 15 feet away. The connection was lost. I tried going different directions thinking it was just something else in the house was interfering with the signal, but no, every time I got about 15 feet away it would disconnect. If I have to stay that close to the stereo, I might as well connect directly to the phone and have better sound quality. Very Unhappy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Theatre Buff

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Awesome product!
customer_reviews.text: I'm stoked. I can finally beam my music in high quality to my stereo without wires. I'm actually using this mostly to send stereo bluetooth audio from my MacBook air to my receiver. I did some A/B comparisons between a wired connection and bluetooth. From my MacBook Air, the bluetooth connection had a lower volume level like some other reviewers had mentioned. The audio quality isn't quite as good as wired, but it's plenty good enough. Unless you're a super audiophile, it should pass the listen test. If you're a super audiophile, you probably wouldn't consider any bluetooth audio product. I'm actually considering getting a second one for my bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy G

customer_reviews.title: clicking popping noises
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with the intention of being able to play my new speakers anywhere in the house. The range is horrible! The speakers make a popping clicking noise when plugged into this device and they do not when plugged straight into my computer. I am using this with a iMac and some harman/kardon soundsticks III. Would not recommend this to ANYONE. it plays the music ok but the clicking noises are SO frustrating to hear especially through such nice speakers. Go with something a little pricier that will probably work better. I am trying to play them from about 30 feet away at most from my computer, they should work way better than they do.
customer_reviews.author: Heron R. Bassett

customer_reviews.title: Can't believe I waited this long!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best purchases of anything I have done in years. I'd been hooking up my iPhone with a cable to my home receiver, but it sucks being tethered and didn't listen to music much as home. Since I've gotten this adapter I've listened to more music/podcasts at home in the past few weeks than the past year. I'm far from an audiophile but it sounds great thought my Harmon Kardon receiver. It works throughout the house, even through walls and close doors. The only real gripe is switching from multiple devices, it can some times get hung up and have to turn it on/off. But if you use only one device you it's fine.
customer_reviews.author: Eurocarguy

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sweet
customer_reviews.text: At first I couldn't increase the volume on my bose lifestyle v28 with this. After messing with the settings it worked. It's a pretty good unit, fairly clear. Of course don't expect to hear digital quality sound from this. It's like 98kbps music vs cd quality. You most likely won't notice the difference, and if you do you'll forget about it soon enough. This is pretty much awesome for letting your friends play music on your system or DJ'ing as you are about the house. I got it to work 40 feet away without going through walls.
customer_reviews.author: Shawzzy

customer_reviews.title: Add Bluetooth to almost any stereo
customer_reviews.text: Use this in my house connected to a stereo receiver it's very versatile and simple to connect your phone too with Bluetooth sound quality is great and the distance is very good as well
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: lag, noisy power supply
customer_reviews.text: Yet another product with a noisy switching power supply. As in sound noise. I'm so sick of these, i'm not even going to say any more about it. If you can find an old wallwart with a real transformer inside, use it to power this thing. I experienced terrible lag using this product with 2 different Android devices. Sound lagged about 500ms-1000ms from what was happening on screen. Totally unusable for playing games or watching movies. For just listening to music I guess it would be ok. Lag doesn't matter in that case.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: fantastic solution to add wireless capability to speakers, receivers and such
customer_reviews.text: Fantasitc solution for adding bluetooth/wireless capabilty to speaker or stereo (or tv). I use at home but best use is at gym...I teach spin and can control my music from the bike...a hit with other instructors and students (gives ability to control volume, as well as music selection) from the bike. UPDATE...this did work great...but then one month after 2 year warranty ended it just suddenly just stopped working. No power...it really is almost as if something was triggered which just shut the unit down...very disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: K. A. Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bluetooth receiver
customer_reviews.text: I've bought several of these things for installing into cars. The reception and sound quality are excellent. You have to press the button once, only so the device can learn new devices. After that, you device will connect to it just by selecting it in bluetooth prefs. If you delete this device from your bluetooth prefs, you'll have to press the sync button again. I think this is great for car installs because nobody can "hijack" your bluetooth streaming device. You do have to disconnect from phone 1 in order to connect phone 2 (assuming phone 2 has already been learned by this device).
customer_reviews.author: Seth Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great streaming solution for a small to medium sized room
customer_reviews.text: This bluetooth speaker adapter has worked great so far with my iPhone and iPad. I'm using it in a small studio apartment, and as long as I'm in the same room with the phone I haven't had any issues with audio cutting out. Connecting a new device is very simple, just hit the connect button and search for the Logitech device on your Phone/tablet/PC's bluetooth menu. Reconnecting after the first time is easy and reliable. The quality of the audio is fine to my ears, of course I'm streaming compressed MP3's to Bose Companion 2 computer speakers, so I'm not expecting perfect reproduction. Those who want longer range should look for a WiFi streaming solution like Apple's Airport Express.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Won't work.  Buy with caution and skepticism.
customer_reviews.text: I have several Apple products. This would not pair with an IPad. With little trouble I got it to pair and then work fine with an IPhone. Later, I tried to pair it with another IPhone. No luck. I cycled power on then off and lost the pairing with the 1st IPhone and could not re-pair the device and any of my Apple products. It simply does not/will not work. I'll try Logitech customer service on Monday but have low expectations. My current assessment: Save your money. This is a bad, inoperable product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Works Well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this with low expectations. As it turned out the connection is clear/stable, the range is good (at least 30 ft), and the sound good too. I saw a few reviews that thought the sound wasn't as good as they would like, but It does better than most wired speakers you can buy. If your one of those people who needs to hear the performers hart beating in the background and are looking to do studio mixing stop being ridiculous, your not going to find any product to make you happy. I do recommend getting better speakers to pair with this because it works so well they will have a much more noticable effect on your sound.
customer_reviews.author: PF Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Don't know why I didn't get one earlier
customer_reviews.text: This is the perfect solution to playing music from my phone through an old stereo system. While sitting out by the pool listening to the radio I really wished I could just play my music off my phone. So I browsed around on Amazon and found out that with this little device it would be easy to do. Two days later with my prime shipping I was all set to play music from my phone or iPad. Really can't believe I didn't discover this earlier. Works great for a range of up to 30 feet. It might skip here or there when moving my phone but once I set it down it usually will maintain a good signal.
customer_reviews.author: LMJAX11

customer_reviews.title: Very clear sound. Works great at a dedent distance
customer_reviews.text: buying this adapter breathed new life into our aging stereo. Now we use it a lot more, thanks to this thing working so flawless. The sound is crystal clear, and the range is wonderful! There are some hiccups though. I'm not sure if it's user error or design issue. I have this thing plugged in all the time, and if I'm playing music through it on one phone, I will have to turn Bluetooth off on that phone before I can connect the other phone. Even when I turned off Bluetooth sometimes, the other phone still wouldn't connect, so I had to restart the Bluetooth adapter, then it would connect fine. Once the phone is connected it works very well!
customer_reviews.author: H00vy

customer_reviews.title: Performs as indicated.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived earlier than stated in the ordering process. This is a simple device - hook up power supply (provided) by plugging the cord in a standard outlet & the other end in the device. Then connect the R and L audio line out from your stereo to the device using the cable provided. The Bluetooth pairing was intuitive - you press the button on top of the device (the only button on it) and the indicator light flashes green and waits for you to initiate pairing from your source (mine was an I-phone). Now I can play the music from my I-phone library through my stereo with the wireless connection.
customer_reviews.author: L. George Allan

customer_reviews.title: Idiot proof!
customer_reviews.text: I consider myself a real idiot when it comes to setting up anything electronic. This was a breeze setting it up on my home stereo receiver and pairing it with my mobile. This inexpensive device has really opened up a whole music world for me at home---all my fave internet radio stations as well as all my music on Amazon Cloud. It is also a very small, inconspicuous black device which is pretty invisible among all my black stereo equipment. There are certain areas of my 926 sq ft condo where I cannot take my mobile without the Logitech adapter losing the signal, but for the most part it works when I carry my mobile around.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Green

customer_reviews.title: Must have in every home!
customer_reviews.text: Avoids the mess of wires and makes playing music over the air seamless. The range is pretty good too. I can connect it to the device from any room/corner in my house(800 sq.ft) and there's no issue at any point of time. When connected to the iPad and I want to switch it to another device, once in a while pressing the reset button on the adapter doesn't disassociate the device. I also would be willing to pay a little more and have more connectivity options on the adapter. Lastly, the device's build quality is very good.
customer_reviews.author: Bala

customer_reviews.title: Great item for using multiple devices with your stereo system
customer_reviews.text: This is one of my favorite purchases off of Amazon. One click to link a bluetooth device - within our household two iphones, two galaxy S3, an ipad2 and asus transformer and 3 laptops. All connect with no problems at all. I bought this to simplify changing streaming sources from the pool area. No need to run indoors and hit the button to change paired devices. Simply disconnect the currently attached device and connect the next one. With 4 phones and multiple tablets plus those of visitors this was a welcome addon to the stereo system for playing music over the outdoor surround speakers. Great product, inexpensive, and works as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: bk

customer_reviews.title: Works as described and excellent value
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a way to stream my music from my iPhone to my home stereo system that didn't require plugging the phone into the stereo. After reading and researching on Amazon I decided to try this product. It is perfect. It plugged right in and worked immediately with no problems at all. The music sounds great coming out of my surround system and the phone can sit on my kitchen counter in the next room with no reception issues at all. Unit is handsome and unobtrusive as well. No modifications necessary for me as some others have described. Works perfect right out of the box. Thanks Logitech for a great 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: F. Patrick

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: I just got my shipment (came much sooner than expected, which was awesome!) and I immediately tested it out. Connecting was a breeze and it worked great...even behind a wall in the next room., but it did start to fade in and out the further I got or the more obstacles there were. I bought this for our simple beachside wedding reception so that we could have someone easily man the iPod DJ app and keep the music running smoothly while still being able to walk around and enjoy the celebration. The wedding is next weekend, so we haven't used it for that purpose yet, but I believe it will serve it's purpose well...and for $40, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: AlohaMama

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: If you power this device off and back on (like in a car), it does not automatically reconnect to my phone (IPhone5) or my mother's phone (Windows). If you leave this device powered on, go out of range (ie. leave your house), and return, it automatically reconnects. So not great for a car bluetooth receiver, but perfect for a home bluetooth receiver. For the car, I recommend the HomeSpot NFC-enabled Bluetooth Receiver on Amazon. It automatically reconnects with my IPhone5 when I start the car as long as I have bluetooth active on my phone at that time.
customer_reviews.author: jhs

customer_reviews.title: WIreless Awesomeness
customer_reviews.text: I can connect all my Apple devices to this product to blast my music and sufficiently annoy all those around. You might hear that the sound quality is not CD quality, but that's okay since we are all listening to sub-par quality music anyways. I can't tell the difference between music out of this device versus that of music plugged directly into my $2,500 Denon receiver and 5 Definitive speakers. It's all good, and the range is as advertised. I haven't had it skip even once in my month of owning it. Also, it's easy as connecting a power cord, discovering it in your devices discovery mode, and listening. Took about 2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, but some flaws
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so that I can stream music from my phone through my stereo speakers while I'm outside on the grill. Sadly, this adapter loses connectivity far too easily for a Bluetooth device. I'm aware that I can't be too far away from the device itself but I shouldn't have a problem at distances like 12ft. Also, I've noticed that at as close as 5ft away from the device and my phone or laptop, if a human body comes directly between the two, the connection will be seriously affected. I may just buy a portable bluetooth speaker to enjoy music while outdoors.
customer_reviews.author: Eddieson

customer_reviews.title: Works As Advertised
customer_reviews.text: Totally plug and play, so all good in that respect. I would give it 5 stars overall except for the fact that I have to really crank up the volume on my receiver to get decent volume when playing through this unit. Not sure why, but I have two of these in use with different systems and it's the same with each one. And I mean REALLY crank it up. It's probably just psychological, but I wince every time I crank the volume that high, knowing that if I were to switch inputs to another source without lowering the volume I might blow the furniture to the other side of the room.
customer_reviews.author: tsihq

customer_reviews.title: Light Years better than the HomeSpot!!
customer_reviews.text: Originally purchased the HomeSpot Bluetooth adapter because of the large amount of positive reviews. The HomeSpot was complete garbage, timing out every 30 seconds or so < 3 ft away from the receiver. Had no luck getting it to work more than 5 feet away. Constant spotty connection going in and out of the music ever second. So I returned that unit and purchased this one. PROBLEM SOLVED. Works GREAT! Sounds just as good and can easily maintian connection and solid sound >10 ft away. MUCH MUCH MUCH better than the HomeSpot.
customer_reviews.author: RobStringG

customer_reviews.title: Great sound, slight lag
customer_reviews.text: This device works great, was easy to connect to, and has a high quality throughput. However, if you want to watch movies or online video using your bluetooth connection, you may notice a small lag. The audio falls about 100 milliseconds late. Compared to DVD Player on my Mac, playing movies in VLC and delaying the audio -100ms solves this problem. Watching YouTube videos is not as bad, with only a slight delay. I'm sooo glad to be rid of the audio cable draping across my couch to play music on my stereo.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M Collins

customer_reviews.title: good piece of work
customer_reviews.text: This is a blue tooth adapter for speakers. It picks up the audio from your computor and puts it though what ever speakers and amplifiers you have in your stereo set. The sound is good. The ease of set up is good. The connection to bluetooth is usually good, but like all bluetooth may have its peculiarities at times. My set up has a woofer. I do not notice any lose of bass. The trebles are clear with no muiffling. My speakers went silent about a month of use. I had an issue with "updating." But once I found the "update button" all went smooth.
customer_reviews.author: gt surber

customer_reviews.title: It is OK but not better than the Berkin
customer_reviews.text: I have the logitech and the Berkin, there are only 2 differences and they are only in size and in price. Performance wise they are the same pretty much. I still need to do what it is suggested for both units and that is to eliminate the metal plate inside to improve the range. Other than that if I need to by another, I would go with the Berkin because of the price. Soundwise they perform the same, I use them both with an Iphone and Itouch and the music sounds pretty good. Yes there is some degradation of the quality but I atribute this to the source and not these receivers.
customer_reviews.author: Red

customer_reviews.title: Perfect extention for my tablet
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to play music to a remote set of speakers. Web search led me to this bluetooth unit. I've had a few days now and it is working perfectly. I live for the winter months in Mesa Arizona in a typical Park Model mobile home so my tablet will always be about 30 feet from the Logitech device. For me, I haven't experienced any outtages or interference. You must plug this device into a "powered" (amplifed) speaker system, not just set of bare speakers. I chose the use CyberAcoustics Subwoofer Satellite System (CA-3602a) for my speaker system. Works great in our small Park Model.
customer_reviews.author: Byron R. Nate

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I thought this was a little pricy, but I'm glad I spent the money. My Macbook pairs with this almost instantly, and I've never had even the slightest bit of trouble with it, ever. The sound quality is superb, which I assume can be partially owed to good data transmission rates. The unit is buried behind my desk, and that doesn't seem the affect the range too much. In fact, I'll be sitting on the other end of my house, forget it's paired, and hear audio coming from my office. Money well spent for a perfectly working product which never fails me.
customer_reviews.author: Seth's Bike Hacks

customer_reviews.title: Works, but has range issues.
customer_reviews.text: As several people have posted here, there are range issues with this device. It struggles to reach more than ~20 feet before the audio will start cutting out. This is pretty frustrating since the kitchen is about 25 feet from the living room receiver and we often use the laptop in the kitchen to control the music and listen through the living room sound system. I haven't yet tried removing the metal portion inside to extend the range as others have suggested. It's still a very cool device, but I'd consider looking elsewhere if you need to reach further than 20 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup, immeasurably small power consumption
customer_reviews.text: Something I try to always do with all of my electronics is to test the power consumption of the device. Currently I am using a "belkin conserve insight" device for this purpose. The insight device cannot detect power consumption of less than 0.5 watts because of line noise. I was impressed, because this Logitech device doesn't even register as using any electricity at all. Nice and efficient. Pros: - Zero power consumption. - Easy setup to my Macbook Air. - Sound quality seems good to me. (keywords: electricity power consumption energy electrical etc)
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our church!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to use in my local church to play audio via bluetooth. Even after reading some comments around the poor distance I wanted to give the device a try anyway and man I'm glad I did! Hooked the thing up to our sound system, connected it to my iPad, walked about 50 feet away and it worked beautifully. Highly recommended so far! I did notice that when I connected it with my laptop the distance was very poor but I think that is my old laptop NOT the device as it works perfectly with my iPhone and iPad. Might get one of these for my car too :)
customer_reviews.author: Straderade

customer_reviews.title: Nice little unit ... but doesn't work with the PS3
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this primarily for use with a PlayStation 3 so I could have sound from my home theater projector and PS3 on one side of the room transmitted to my stereo near the screen. The unit works wonderfully with my Android tablet and smartphone, but won't work with the PS3. After purchasing, I discovered that the PS3 does not have support for bluetooth audio output. Not really useful in my situation, but a nice little unit. Would have been nice if Logitech had specifically mentioned PS3 compatibility in the specs for the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Randy A. Riddle

customer_reviews.title: wow.  amazing stereo quality.  lossless audio quality.
customer_reviews.text: wow. amazing stereo quality. lossless audio quality. i bought 2 at 40.00 just before christmas, now they are 72.00 on up. i wish they were at 40.00 and i would buy one. that is why i came to amazon today. they lost a sale due to inflated prices. buy it if you want the absolute best bluetooth experience. thank you logitech for an amazing device. plus get the logitech z623 2.1 speaker set for your computer or phone thru this adapter. i play straight from my phone to the speakers and the sound quality is awesome. you will be blown away by the sound. excellent bass with the z623s.
customer_reviews.author: fred here

customer_reviews.title: DJ on the go! No more wires
customer_reviews.text: Great range all around the pool area and back patio area. I'm easily getting about 30 to 40 feet from the receiver. It's nice to walk around with the i pad or cell phone with no wires attached, Even better now that I bought the new Samsung Galaxy s5 Active which I can take to the pool get it wet and control the music from inside the pool. Keep in mind that the range may be affected by nearby antennas or power lines. I don't have any of this so it works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: inspector gadget 007

customer_reviews.title: Excellent solution for a bedroom
customer_reviews.text: Set this up with some logitech 2.1 speakers for my mom's bedroom. She loves it. Set up is super fast and painless when using a very large knife to cut through the obscene plastic packaging (otherwise, beware the razor-sharp plastic). Pairing with her ipad, and my android phone, similarly so. I'd say start to finish was approximately 5 minutes. Audio quality was good and without reception problems. I haven't fully tested the range beyond the intended application, i.e., a large bedroom and sitting area (some other reviewers report a rather short range), but we have no problems in the 10-15 foot range.
customer_reviews.author: R. Kao

customer_reviews.title: Working Well so Far....
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this item after having issues with a similar and less expensive unit from Belkin. I am currently streaming Pandora and my Amazon MP3 library through this unit from a Xoom Tablet to an old receiver that powers 5 separate sets of speakers in my home. It was very easy to hook this unit to my receiver and then pair with the Bluetooth. The Belkin unit began to cut out intermittently after about an hour of use. I tried to reset the unit and the Bluetooth connection on several occasions with no luck. The Logitech unit has not failed once and I have run it continuously for over 5 hours at a time on several occasions.
customer_reviews.author: FB

customer_reviews.title: Flawless!
customer_reviews.text: I received this Logitech adapter two days ago. I LOVE IT! -Setup was simple. -Connectivity is also simple. Works with my iPhone 4S and Nexus 7. -Bluetooth range is good. I can go anywhere inside my modest 1100sq.ft. home with my devices in tow. No drops. No hiccups. (adapter is installed inside my media cabinet) -Audio levels are on par with the satellite receiver and BluRay player that are connected to the same Sony A/V unit. Thank you Logitech for bringing consistent, high quality devices to the marketplace.
customer_reviews.author: Beauty Fool

customer_reviews.title: Versitile and works well!
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. The advantage of this over others (like the Belkin model) is that you have TWO sets of outputs: an 1/8" stereo (headphone) output and a left/right stereo RCA output. This gives you versatility for connecting, be it to a stereo receiver or a set of computer speakers. Sometimes, my audio cuts out. But I have come to believe it is the number of obstacles I have between my Bluetooth enabled music player and this receiver (two pieces of furniture and a wall corner) and not an inherent problem with this device.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Allows full Bluetooth communicae
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed to allow a device such as a home theater receiver or sound system to connect to any bluetooth device. Simple set up - scan and allow like normal. Worked so well for sound system, that I bought another for the home theater system. Now we can send audio from our iPod or laptop through the systems speakers - changing volume or selection from the device as we please without having to be tethered. Ours work across a 30 foot room and a 25 foot room with no dropping. Ideal for controlling music at a party without letting everyone handle - or mishandle - the system.
customer_reviews.author: Shoop

customer_reviews.title: It does as advertised, but sound is flat.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to bring the wireless world of sound into my older Onkyo home theater system. It serves this purpose but the sound loses much of the top and bottom end of the musical range. Does it work? Yes. Does it sound good? No. If you want to listen to talk radio (I do sometime) it works great! Do not buy this product if you want to enjoy the classic's, or classic rock. I plan on using this to add sound to my pool area, it should work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Pensacola Mark

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Wireless Connectivity
customer_reviews.text: I loved this Logitech Bluetooth adapter so much I bought a second. My first adapter is connected to my Yamaha stereo and provides me an excellent avenue to wirelessly stream iPhone and iPad music through a high-quality stereo with excellent soudn quality results. I paired my second adapter with the little $20, 20 watt, LP-2020A+ Lepai Tripath Class-T Hi-Fi Audio Mini Amplifier with Power Supply and a set of old desktop speakers for a wonderful patio sound system that also streams my favorite music from my iPhone and iPad. I'm about to buy a third adapter to use with my Bose 123 in the bedroom.
customer_reviews.author: Deanne

customer_reviews.title: Worked right out of the box...
customer_reviews.text: Received it, installed it and it worked! It was a miracle as far as I am concerned, lol. Especially if you are electronically challenged. The directions are clear and have pictures if you are unsure of what you read. I plugged mine into my receivers auxiliary plug in's and that was that. Well, and then turning my bluetooth on, on my iPhone5. Now I can hear my music throughout my home, inside and outside as I have speakers throughout. How awesome is that to be able to do this when my receiver is at least 10 years old. Thanks Logitech, you came through for me yet again.
customer_reviews.author: DLO

customer_reviews.title: Works great!  Exceeded expectations.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to bridge my cell phone to my home stereo system and it works awesome! I took it out of the package, plugged one wire into the wall and the other into one of the inputs on the back of my stereo, then clicked the one button to set it to "discover" mode, then picked up my Motorola Droid cell phone, tapped on Settings --> Wireless and Network --> Bluetooth --> Search for Devices and selected this Logitech from the list. Then I tapped Home, swiped over to my Pandora icon, tapped...and VOILA!!! I've got my Hawaii Five-O surf music blaring in my backyard. SWEET!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Logitech Wireless Bluetooth Audio adapter
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a convenient way to send wireless audio from my Toshiba tablet to my A/V receiver that would provide reasonably high-quality sound. The Logitech speaker adapter does the job flawlessly. The choice of connections is either a set of standard RCA stereo connections, or a mini-jack (like an Ipod headphone cable). Had this installed and Bluetooth paired in under 10 minutes with no issues. Within the audio limitations of Bluetooth, the audio quality is better than I expected. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Muraski

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: We bought this as a gift for my parents whose fancy home stereo system (speakers in the ceilings of every room) didn't have an aux in port. Not having an aux port meant no way of plugging an iphone, ipod, or their kindle fire into their sound system. We plugged in this little bluetooth adapter using RCA cables and it works perfectly. My parents can now use their kindle or iphone from any room to control the music and they love it! Music quality is fabulous - one would never know it's a bluetooth connection. Now I just need one for myself!
customer_reviews.author: jlaura

customer_reviews.title: Worked better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Attached this to our surround sound system in our basement which is then attached to speakers throughout the whole house. To test it I hooked up the receiver and left it downstairs and tried using it upstairs directly above the room. To my surprise there was no skipping or loss of sound. Usually once you go through walls you start getting choppy connection but with this device I didn't lose signal until I went into 2 rooms away upstairs from the device. Plan on hooking it up on the main floor so that it can be used essentially anywhere. Great product. Great receiving capabilities.
customer_reviews.author: Corey

customer_reviews.title: Better then I thought!!
customer_reviews.text: Right out of the box I had this hooked up and paired with my I phone in 5 min. The sound quality is good but it all depends what speakers you use. I use a set of JVC wireless speakers and the sound is not bad. My biggest concern was distance as this will be located inside near the speaker transmitter, but I will be outside on my deck where my speakers are. Well they say you might get 30 feet but to my surprise I got at least 45 before it started to break up. That made my day and I was sold. Now I can play Pandora and surf the web next to my pool. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: D. E.

customer_reviews.title: this is great stuff
customer_reviews.text: we have a lot of thunderstorms in Kansas and I can now use my smart phone to send music to my pc speakers by plugging them into this gadget. I can leave my pc and stereo unplugged during the storm and just risk my inexpensive speakers. I've shown them to a few other people that would like to hear music at work but aren't allowed to stream on the company internet. I've bought a couple other adapters before that were supposed to do this same thing and they didn't work very well. this Logitech adapter does the job well, easily and sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Kansas Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Works great, has some limitations
customer_reviews.text: I use this in the office because my iPhone audio-out cradle finally died. I now have a power only cradle and use this to connect to a Bose wave radio in my office. Easy to set up. Limitations: 1. The volume output is lower than I expected, but fine for an office....you aren't going to blow out Rush at a high volume! 2. It does not automatically connect to my iPhone. From what I've read, it is designed that way...not a big deal, just a few touches of the phone and I'm all set to go.
customer_reviews.author: I. Band

customer_reviews.title: Great in between for adding Bluetooth connectivity for older devices
customer_reviews.text: Great in between for adding Bluetooth connectivity for older devices. Have an old stereo with only RCA's? Boom, Bluetooth from your phone right into you hi-fi... Have an outdated mini speaker with only an Aux in? Boom, Bluetooth! Will break up a little when you get outside it's recommended range, but I've seen if you have a direct line of sight to the unit or put it high up, that'll help.
customer_reviews.author: SPB

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth Hook up to Stereo
customer_reviews.text: The product does everything promised. It took me all of five minutes to unbox and set up the adapter. I connected it to my stereo system using the wire included with the unit. The remarkable thing about the unit is that I can sit in my office, about 30 feet away, and listen to content from my IPHONE and can control it. This is a much better option for me than buying a bluetooth connected speaker as my stereo speakers are obviously much better in quality to anything I could have bought. I highly recommend it to anyone that has similar requirements.
customer_reviews.author: Donald S. Bauman

customer_reviews.title: Great device for a low price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little device if you want to add some fun to your home entertainment area. I first bought one of these devices and hooked it up in the Computer Lab for a school that I work in. The students love it (a bit too much I must say). I have since bought two (2) more for home. I have one in my office to eliminate wires and allow multiple devices to connect to my speakers. The other is in the living room which friends and family love to play around with during our limes. I only wish that there was a way to set the passcode to one I want rather than the default.
customer_reviews.author: Louis R. Ramdhanie

customer_reviews.title: Upgrade Your Stereo
customer_reviews.text: I have a mini hometheater system that was bought in the 90s and works just fine. I couldn't see myself just scraping it. This bluetooth adapter allows me to watch my tablet and use the hometheater wirelessly. I took the advice, located the screws underneath the rubber footstays, removed the metal plate inside the unit (which was just glued) and now it can almost cover my 800 sq ft apt let alone my whole kitchen and family room. The adapter is small enough to hide and when your device is linked a beep sounds through your speakers so there's no need to get up and press buttons. There's no clarity or sound issues.
customer_reviews.author: mako

customer_reviews.title: works great but not sure if this supports aptx for the best sound
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Only one thing to takeaway point. One needs to press connect button to pair with Bluetooth device. Purchased one from a different manufacture and it doesn't need to push button and it is always ready to pair. Of course once you pair with this Logitech device ...it remembers it. Oh yea ... other device had an optical output. Don't know how many devices this can pair with but Ihave paired this with my Android phone and tablet.
customer_reviews.author: Roger L. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Logitech Wireless Speaker Adapter to hookup my iPad to the stereo we have in the kitchen. It works great and was easy to connect. I did notice the range is somewhat limited. You need to be under 15 feet before you start to drop audio but let's be honest this really isn't a limitation for me. :-) The audio quality is good and about what you would expect from Bluetooth. The device could be about $10 cheaper but overall I am very happy and have not had any issues with it. I have hooked up my iPad and iPhone to it and it worked great. I would certainly buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: jchawk

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Range for an iPhone 5 in an unobstructed livingroom was about 18-20 feet. Range for an iPad Retina (first gen) was about 10-15 feet though until I started to experience occasional drops in audio. Still, this allows me to retire my Logitech Duet which is incredibly unreliable when it comes to Rhapsody, Pandora, and no Spotify support. I will miss having my remote, but the iPhone/iPad or whatever device you choose to use essentially becomes the remote anyway, with far more information on screen and far easier control. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: DJDDay

customer_reviews.title: Item works great with Apple devices...MacBook Air, iPhone and iPod Touch!
customer_reviews.text: The range on this unit is so good, I have to remind my self to disconnect it so that I can utilize the audio on my MacBook Air. The Logitech Wireless Speaker Adapter is located in my basement. It will reach to my second story. What else can I say, this device will turn your old boom box or stereo into a modern piece of electronics. As for bass or sound thru put, it sounds fine to me. I'm not exactly an audiophile, but am pretty attune to what sounds good or not. Very happy I went with Logitech.
customer_reviews.author: Becky C

customer_reviews.title: Excellent to Receiver-deteriorated over time
customer_reviews.text: I have a logitech boombox and this device for bluetooth connectivity. The purpose of this for me was to integrate my itunes library into my stereo systems on the cheap, from an IPAD. Both work great. They sound great to me and I am very happy about the connectivity. Meets my needs and it may meet yours too. Thinking about an IPOD or another device now. Wife has a zune. Good Luck! After having this for a while I have noticed that it has lost its punch. Bass and volume. I have purchased another and will do some testing with another receiver. Built in airplay may be better.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Hoskins

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: This worked OK, but definitely NOT better than their $27 unit that does exactly the same thing. I tried both on the same receiver using two different sources and this was not any better at all. If they are going to charge 5 times as much, it should be a hell of a lot better. #980-000910 Logitech Bluetooth Audio Adapter will save you $100 ASIN:B00IQBSW28
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hall

customer_reviews.title: Fine functionality; good value.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device to connect my iPad to my high-end stereo. It has performed as expected, with no fuss. But the downside of "as expected" is that the audio quality isn't up the rest of the system. But then, for this price, I didn't expect it to be. I just couldn't find a bluetooth adapter that was markedly better, though I'd have been willing to pay a lot more to get one. And for the kind of listening I do from the iPad, really, this is adequate.
customer_reviews.author: David A. Wandelt

customer_reviews.title: Nice Music Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Good product, worked pretty well for what I wanted it to do. I wanted to use this to play music files from my PC through a home theater system, both on opposite sides of the house. Hook up and pairing were very simple, worked flawlessly. Sound quality is decent, though not great. Do not expect it to sound as good as wired hookup. May get better results playing through good quality powered speakers or if music device is placed closer to the wireless adapter, however. It is a good solution for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Alan F.

customer_reviews.title: Does what is intended to do, seamlessly
customer_reviews.text: I had a nice pair of Bose powered speakers in my last home that didn't seem to have a place in our "downsized" home. Hated to sell them at a garage sale! But with this adapter, I put them in our exercise room so anyone can connect via Bluetooth (from iPhone for example) to them! Can now listen to playlists or Pandora without headphones while exercising. Or, can tune into internet radio stations. Excellent sound quality, too. Slick that my Bose speakers are preserved, can now leave them to my kids in the will.
customer_reviews.author: Steve K

customer_reviews.title: Great way to hear music from a smart phone or tablet on your stereo
customer_reviews.text: This device makes any stereo or powered speaker system a Bluetooth device. My local audio store claimed such a device cost about $150 and would have a range of 10 feet. This sounded like bull*#$t so I went to Amazon and found this. Comes with a cable to connect to any RCA or mini jack input. I have paired it to my Android phone, iPad and laptop and used it with two stereos and several powered speaker units without any problems. Love it for listening to Pandora while my phone is in my pocket and projecting to my stereo. Range about 30 feet.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas E. Mcintyre

customer_reviews.title: Little BT Box That Could
customer_reviews.text: Great device. There's one button on the top of the Adapter that you press and hold to initially pair a device with it and after that, you can connect to it without touching it at all. There's an LED on the front of it that is red when nothing is connected and green when something is connected to it. Works as advertised and the audio quality is crisp. I purchased this over the popular Belkin device because I didn't want to have to open up and modify the device before being able to use it. In the end, I'm pleased with my purchase, no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Salesmunn

customer_reviews.title: Solid product, ridiculously easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: I have to say "ditto" to the other reviews that have described how easy it was to set this up. It literally took me longer to unpack the thing than it did to hook it up to my home stereo/theater system. My android phone (Evo) found it in less than 20 seconds, and before I knew it I was listening to all of the music on my phone. Unless you're a true audio junkie who spends thousands upon thousands on sound equipment, you'll probably be more than satisfied with the sound quality. I actually think it's better than when I was listening to music from my phone connected to the stereo with a wire.
customer_reviews.author: AFV

customer_reviews.title: Work as described.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little device to have at home but there are a few little things that should be noted. First if you're using a microwave while using this device you'll have interference. The range on this device is about 15-25ft if you're in the same room. There is a metal in the casing that if taking out will increase the range or you can turn the device up sided down and that will gain you few more feet in range. Connection was easy just a click of the button, as for the quality of the sound. hmm!!! well it's not great but it's okay.
customer_reviews.author: Oneil

customer_reviews.title: Does as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Logitech wireless speaker adapter for a few weeks now. It's connected to my home stereo via a 10 band graphic eq then into my receiver. It's awesome to be able to play music from my phone or from the laptop computer. I have quite a collection of music on my phone so I usually use that as my primary device. The Logitech device was super easy to set up as described by other users. It also has a decent range coupled with my cell phone(Galaxy S Blaze. If you're looking for something to stream your music this is an excellent device to check out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and set up
customer_reviews.text: This product works just as expected. There is a button on top which you press to begin the bluetooth pairing, and then you just search for it on your phone or ipod. It works with Android and iPhone; I've tried both. You can play Pandora, TuneIn radio, iTunes, or whatever through your phone, plug this into your stereo aux in, and you have remote control sound. This works great for me in a house with a radiant barrier where I get lousy radio reception. Keep the phone near the unit, or you will lose signal after about 30 feet (at least inside). This is a limitation of bluetooth, not the device.
customer_reviews.author: William A. Fahle

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Small. Light. Easy to configure. Sound quality is fine within 20-30'. Begins to skip at further ranges as per the limitations of bluetooth when walls/objects intervene. I rigged it up in my girlfriend's kitchen to an old (but powerful) set of computer speakers so she could listen to music in there via her phone. She loves it and the whole rig cost me 80$ (50$ speakers). Beats the hell out of any airplay rig I could have bought. And now to spend those brownie points.....
customer_reviews.author: Tobias L Merriman

customer_reviews.title: good bluetooth audio adapter for home theatre.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Works great with my Yamaha speaker bar and my Android phones and tablets. Pros: For single devices the setup and usage is simple as can be and the sound is really good! Google music is now being used continuously in our house. Cons: For multiple devices, its a bit of a pain, but I have found this to be the case for most Bluetooth devices, and have gotten used to it. I often have to unpair and re-pair to switch between phone and tablet, but it just takes a few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: J. Adam Noah

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little product
customer_reviews.text: Bought this when it dropped from $80 to $40 and it has been well worth it. It's very easy to connect with anything that has bluetooth capabilities. I was looking at some other products that were $20-$30 but I'm glad I went with this one. Logitech has always been a trusted name to me and never let me down. I connected this to my home theater and have connected my iPhone, tablet, computer, and even my girlfriend's iPhone. Would recommend to anyone looking for wireless play through their home theater.
customer_reviews.author: RB

customer_reviews.title: Quick setup
customer_reviews.text: This took all of 5 minutes to set up. It took longer to rip it out of the packaging. You'll only need to look at the instructions for 2 reasons: if you get asked for a bluetooth setup code [the standard 0000] or if you're confused whether you need the red and white connections or the single connection going into the unit [if you're hooking up to a tuner on a sound system, just the single]. I tested a couple streaming mp3's from amazon's cloud server and only had a a couple blips.
customer_reviews.author: David Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with my older whole house system. I have an older Panasonic radio that pipes into my whole house speakers. I just plugged this into the Aux RCA adapters and turned it on. My phone picked it up and now I'm streaming to my house system. I took me more time to take it out of the package than it did to get it working. It's a great option for streaming music to an older system with an RCA aux port.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnson

customer_reviews.title: TERRIBLE RANGE. ONLY WORKS IF DEVICE IS ABOUT 2 FEET AWAY!
customer_reviews.text: This worked okay when I had it directly next to the device I was streaming from, but I recently moved my desk and computer to the other side of the room (only 15 feet away) and it works HORRIBLY. It constantly cuts in and out, even just from walking in between my computer and the device. I can't even sit at my computer and stream music to the adapter. If you're looking for a wireless speaker adapter, LOOK ELSEWHERE.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Love This Thing
customer_reviews.text: I have really enjoyed this unit. I've used it to stream music at my desk from both my Android phone and my iPad with no issue. I ended up giving to my wife to use in our kitchen/family space along with a pair of Bose Companion speakers. They sit up on bank of kitchen cabinets. She can simply select to stream from her iPhone to it without any fuss and the range of this unit is great. It even works between floors and rooms in our house. One thing that would be nice is an off switch, but it's not really necessary given it's current location. Pros: - Great range - Ease of setup Cons: - No off switch
customer_reviews.author: S. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: better than tripping on wires
customer_reviews.text: works well . Very handy. better than tripping on wires . Uses Bluetooth. If your amp doesnt have Bluetooth built in , this is for you . You just have to reboot it every week or two for some reason . that just involves un and replugging in the power cord . Easy peasy. It plugs into the RCA input jacks on an amplifier or I think an AUX IN jack . Came with those cable I think . Logitech is generally good stuff as in this case
customer_reviews.author: Finestkind

customer_reviews.title: Solid Sound, Amazingly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: After researching a dozen or so similar products, most ranging over $75, I decided to give this a try and I love it. Connecting it is cake; one cable to the receive, one cable to power plug, hit the little button and let your smart phone scan for bluetooth. DONE! Sound quality and clarity is wonderful and the range is excellent. I've had my Apple phone (ver 4), about to 25 feet away and could still hear the speakers playing my audio. Its an excellent product that will open up a new door to audio listening.
customer_reviews.author: Spaceghost

customer_reviews.title: Should bought a long time ago
customer_reviews.text: In words of Sheldon Cooper "Anything better with bluetooth!" If you don't know whether or not you need this wireless speaker adapter it it's easy find out: do you have a smartphone that you listen music from? if yes - do you have a speakers in your house? if yes on bought of those questions then you'll need it. You don't know it yet but you will when you'l get it. Great gift idea by the way. Not everybody will buy it for themselves because of the price. I even like how it looks.
customer_reviews.author: Vadim

customer_reviews.title: Great way to stream music wirelessly...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Logitech Wireless Speaker Adapter to replace a Belkin unit that had gone bad. My wife uses this to stream music from her MacBook Air to our living room stereo. The Logitech appears to have much better range and the sound seems fuller than the Belkin. I did however prefer the Belkin's smaller size. If you are looking for an effective way to stream music wirelessly this is an excellent way to go.
customer_reviews.author: acron1

customer_reviews.title: Be ready to sacrifice quality for convenience.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my studio monitors and sub. I bought it for the convenience of streaming from my phone anywhere in the house. The signal is not as great as I thought. WALLS WILL BLOCK SIGNAL! Also keep in mind that blootooth is nice, but the audio quality will take a hit. I played some music from my laptop and compared the quality of using bluetooth vs using a 1/4 cable straight into the studio monitors. Plugging in sounded way better. It doesn't hurt to have and might come in handy sometime, but I hardly use it because I constantly have to pair it to my laptop (along with the quality degradation and not so great signal).
customer_reviews.author: Mark Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Way cool!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I hooked this up to my Bose, then I hooked it up to the Bluetooth on my phone, then I pressed play on the wonderful playlist I put together with the help of spotify and what I got was pure joy. I have never enjoyed such happiness while cleaning my house. Usually I have to stop to change the music when either the cd finishes or a song that makes me cringe comes on, but not with this. I love this little cube of freedom.
customer_reviews.author: Queen E

customer_reviews.title: Works great with Fender guitar amp auxiliary input.
customer_reviews.text: I have this plugged into the mini jack on a Fender Mustang Guitar amplifier. It allows me to easily collect my android phone to the amp to play music through the amplifier. Great for practicing along with songs on my phone. Works so good that my kids are now "stealing" the Logitech adapter and my amp to bring our by the pool to play music at their parties... That way the neighbors can enjoy their tunes with them... :-)
customer_reviews.author: Rocketman

customer_reviews.title: I really like this thing.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this receiver for use with my Microsoft Surface Pro. It paired easily the first time I set it up and it has remained paired every time I've booted/rebooted my SurfPro. I use it frequently and haven't heard the slightest distortion in anything I've piped through it so far, no loss of signal. Audio from video seems to come through without delay (unlike earlier bluetooth products). Range has been surprisingly very good without any modding, with good reception from my living room to bedroom and a bathroom between the two. It's a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great bluetooth adapter but make sure you remove the metal plate!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bluetooth adapter. I need to buy another!! I would have given it 5 stars but I had to open it (void the warranty) to remove the metal plate as another reviewer suggested. After removing that plate, this thing gets the signal strength it should have come with out of the box. The music quality is also amazing as I've compared it with other bluetooth adapters in this price range. If it has the features you're looking for, buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Chris MajesticTop Contributor: Smart Home

customer_reviews.title: handy
customer_reviews.text: this is a great add on to my home stero. i can play music from my tablet/phone/desktop/laptop no problem. the only downide is any time i need to switch to another device that is paired with it i have to re use the connect button on the device and bisically re pair it every time i want to use a different device. it only has the memory for one device at a time. i did remove the bottom metal peice as in another review and it definitely helped with the signal distance.
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little device!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this device five stars because it did everything and more that I expected of it. It connects flawlessly with my windows devices. My iPhone 4 S doesn't like it for some reason. It connects, but I was have to uninstall it and reinstall it each time. The range is awesome I can walk anywhere in my entire house without losing the connection. No popping noises or breaking up whatsoever. Installation was a snap. I have it hooked into my home entertainment system. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MavRick

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: Works well for streaming audio from Bluetooth devices. I don't have complaints on the audio quality however so far I've only used it with MP3s (256-320kbps) and streaming radio. It doesn't seem to have any significant impedance mismatch with my NAD C320BEE -- it is *much* better than connecting directly to the line out on the iPad 3. It's a good versatile little device that is a great convenience when you have multiple audio sources in the room (computers, phones, tablets).
customer_reviews.author: nadia

customer_reviews.title: Problems with multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: Once it locks onto a device it works ok but if I try and switch between my iphone and ipad it will not be able to connect to the second device even if I reset the power. If you only have one device and are not far from the unit it should work fine but if you want to switch between more than one device this thing is unfortunately not the answer.
customer_reviews.author: Bdogg82

customer_reviews.title: Stable powerful bluetooth signal
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality adapter with stable connection. If you have any problems, I suggest you check out your output device like your phone or tablet. Example: My HTC One S has a syncing issue with video and bluetooth audio. So during conversations in a movie, the audio would be delayed. My Acer Iconia A100 has an issue with the bluetooth disconnecting after extensive usage, so I have to turn off the bluetooth and then on, and resync.
